overview: Beginning 1/1/2026, this measure requires pharmacy technicians to be registered with and obtain a certificate of registration from the Board of Pharmacy. [12] It imposes a duty on pharmacists-in-charge to report violations conducted by registered pharmacy technicians. [12] The measure specifies that supervising registered pharmacists are responsible for the actions of registered pharmacy technicians and pharmacy interns and has an effective date of December 31, 2050. [12] [11]
agency_impact: To align the measure with the Boardâ€™s current Hawaii Administrative Rules (HAR), the Board requested amendments which were adopted by the committee. [10] [12] The committee deleted language that would have required the supervision of a registered pharmacy technician by a registered pharmacist to be "direct". [12] The committee also deleted language from the definition of "supervision" that would have required the responsible registered pharmacist to be physically present to oversee a registered pharmacy technician or pharmacy technician performing certain acts. [12]
economic_impact: The registration fee for a pharmacy technician shall be $20.00 (HB72_SD1_.HTM.txt). [11] Any person who violates any of the provisions of this chapter or the rules adopted pursuant to this chapter shall be fined no less than $100.00 (HB72_SD1_.HTM.txt) and no more than $1,000.00 (HB72_SD1_.HTM.txt) for each violation. [11]
policy_impact: The measure adds new definitions to chapter 461, Hawaii Revised Statutes, for "Auxiliary pharmacy personnel", "Registered pharmacy technician", and "Supervision". [11] It amends the powers and duties of the board to include issuing certificates of registration for registered pharmacy technicians. [11] Disciplinary actions under section 461-21 are expanded to allow the board to deny, revoke, or suspend any registration. [11]
revenue_sources: Revenue will be generated from a registration fee for pharmacy technicians. [11] The registration fee for a pharmacy technician shall be $20.00 (HB72_SD1_.HTM.txt). [11] Each certificate of registration shall be valid through December 31 of each odd-numbered year, upon which a new registration shall be required. [11]
six_year_fiscal_implications: Beginning January 1, 2026, the State will collect revenue from a biennial registration fee for pharmacy technicians. [11] [11] The registration fee for a pharmacy technician shall be $20.00 (HB72_SD1_.HTM.txt). [11] Each certificate of registration shall be valid through December 31 of each odd-numbered year. [11] This will require the board to issue certificates of registration for registered pharmacy technicians and renew permits to operate pharmacies. [11] The board may also fine, suspend, or revoke any registration or permit for any cause prescribed by this chapter. [11] Any person who violates any of the provisions of this chapter shall be fined no less than $100.00 (HB72_SD1_.HTM.txt) and no more than $1,000.00 (HB72_SD1_.HTM.txt) for each violation. [11] The supervising registered pharmacist shall be responsible for the actions of the registered pharmacy technician. [11] A registered pharmacy technician may perform filling, packaging, manipulative, repetitive, or other nondiscretionary tasks, only while assisting and while under the supervision and control of a registered pharmacist. [11] Section 26H-6, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which concerns the repeal of professional and occupational licensing acts, shall not apply to this Act. [11] This Act shall take effect on December 31, 2050. [11]
operating_revenue_impact: Operating revenue will increase from the collection of biennial registration fees. [11] The registration fee for a pharmacy technician is $20.00 (HB72_SD1_.HTM.txt). [11] Additional, non-recurring revenue may be generated from fines for violations, which range from $100.00 (HB72_SD1_.HTM.txt) to $1,000.00 (HB72_SD1_.HTM.txt). [11]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: Ongoing fiscal implications will include recurring biennial revenue from the pharmacy technician registration fee of $20.00 (HB72_SD1_.HTM.txt). [11] The requirement for biennial renewal of the certificate of registration will ensure a continuous revenue stream. [11] The committee inserted an effective date of December 31, 2050, to encourage further discussion. [12]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: This measure has been amended to include a new registration fee for pharmacy technicians of $20.00 (HB72_SD1_.HTM.txt) and fines for violations ranging from $100.00 (HB72_SD1_.HTM.txt) to $1,000.00 (HB72_SD1_.HTM.txt). [11] [11] Following recommendations from the Board of Pharmacy, language that would have required supervision to be "direct" or for the pharmacist to be "physically present" has been deleted. [12] [12] The measure now statutorily defines "Auxiliary pharmacy personnel", "Registered pharmacy technician", and "Supervision". [11] A new effective date of December 31, 2050, has been inserted to encourage further discussion. [12]
